alert.note: Alert for Lake (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 22 at 6:01AM MST until December 22 at 7:00AM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Central Lake County in central Colorado... * Until 700 AM MST. * At 557 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located over Leadville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 50 mph could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. SOURCE...Webcams and surface observations. IMPACT...Travel will be difficult and potentially dangerous through 7 am. Locations impacted include... Leadville, Mt Massive, Twin Lakes, Turquoise Lake, Leadville North and Mt Elbert. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. Conditions will improve after 7 am as snowfall lessens.
